intro: Ditaxis sellowiana, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit or yellow starfruit, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers and woody stems. The plant produces small, star-shaped fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded areas within forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural gardens.
